intro: Astroloma pinifolium, commonly known as the needle-leaved astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in spring. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. Astroloma pinifolium is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and salt spray.
